greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of functions from [1,2,...,n] to [1,2,...,n] such that the image contains exactly k elements (0<=k<=n).
comment: Another version is in A101817. - _Philippe Deléham_, Feb 16 2013
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..62, flattened
C. M. Ringel, The Catalan combinatorics of the hereditary artin algebras, arXiv preprint arXiv:1502.06553, 2015
formula: T(n,k) = n * (T(n-1,k-1) + k/(n-k) * T(n-1,k)) with T(n,n) = n! and T(n,0) = 0 for n>0.
mathematica: Table[Table[StirlingS2[n, k] Binomial[n, k] k!, {k, 0, n}], {n, 0,10}] // Flatten  (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Sep 09 2011 *)
xref: Row sums give: A000312. Columns k=0-2 give: A000007, A001477, A068605. Diagonal, lower diagonal give: A000142, A001804. Cf. A007318, A048993, A019538, A008279.
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Dec 14 2003
ext: Revised description from Jan Maciak, Apr 25 2004
